com.st.st25sdk

Class Helper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.Helper

  • public class Helper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods to ease programming for tag management

    • Method Detail

      • stringForceDigit

        public static java.lang.String stringForceDigit(java.lang.String stringToFormat,
                                                int nbOfDigits)
        Prefixes a String containing decimal characters with zeroes until it reaches the specified number of digit. Examples: 
         
   Helper.stringForceDigit("23", 4); // returns "0023"
   Helper.stringForceDigit("54", 7); // returns "0000054"
   Helper.stringForceDigit(null, 3); // returns "000"
        Parameters:
        stringToFormat - String to be modified
        nbOfDigits - Target number of numerical ASCII characters
        Returns:
        original String preceded by stringToFormat.length() - nbOfDigits number of zeroes

      • convertByteToHexString

        public static java.lang.String convertByteToHexString(byte byteToConvert)
        Converts byte value to a "2-char String" Format. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertByteToHexString((byte) 0X0F); // returns "0F"
        Parameters:
        byteToConvert - Byte value to be converted to its Hex String representation
        Returns:
        String containing hex representation of byteToConvert

      • convertHexByteArrayToString

        public static java.lang.String convertHexByteArrayToString(byte[] byteArrayToConvert)
        Convert byte Array to a String formated with spaces. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertHexByteArrayToString(new byte[]{0X0F, 0X43}); // returns "0f 43"
        Parameters:
        byteArrayToConvert - byte[] to be converted to a String
        Returns:
        String representing the byte array in hex characters with a space between each byte. Returns "" for a null input.

      • printHexByteArray

        public static void printHexByteArray(java.lang.String msg,
                                     byte[] byteArrayToPrint)
        Logs a byte Array in hexadecimal format (debugging tool). Example: 
         
   Helper.printHexByteArray(new byte[]{0X0F, 0X43}); // Logs String "0F 43"
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to log
        byteArrayToPrint - Byte array to log after the message String

      • convertIntToHexFormatString

        public static java.lang.String convertIntToHexFormatString(int numberToConvert)
        Converts an int value to a String with Hexadecimal format. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertIntToHexFormatString(2047); // returns "7FF"
        Parameters:
        numberToConvert - int to convert to Hex String
        Returns:
        String-equivalent of int argument

      • convertHexStringToByteArray

        public static byte[] convertHexStringToByteArray(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a String containing a hex dump into a byte array. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertHexStringToByteArray("0F43BB079A"); // returns [0X0F, 0X43, 0xBB,  0x07, 0x9A]
        Parameters:
        s - String to convert
        Returns:
        byte array (empty byte array if s == null or is an empty String)

      • convertByteArrayToHexString

        public static java.lang.String convertByteArrayToHexString(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array into a String containing a hex dump. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertByteArrayToHexString(new byte[]{0X0F, 0X43, (byte) 0xBB, 0x07, (byte) 0x9A}); // returns "0F43BB079A"
        source: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9655181/how-to-convert-a-byte-array-to-a-hex-string-in-java
        Parameters:
        bytes - byte[] to convert to Hex String
        Returns:
        String (returns "" for null argument)

      • convertStringToInt

        public static int convertStringToInt(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a String containing decimal characters into an int. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertStringToInt("1234"); // returns 1234
        Parameters:
        s - String to convert to an int value
        Returns:
        Value extracted from a String containing decimal ASCII characters

      • convertHexStringToInt

        public static int convertHexStringToInt(java.lang.String hexNumber)
                                 throws STException
        Converts a String containing hexadecimal characters into an int. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertHexStringToInt("43A89"); // returns 0x43A89
        Parameters:
        hexNumber - String containing hex ASCII characters
        Returns:
        int value extracted from the String
        Throws:
        STException - BAD_PARAMETER if String is null or empty

      • convertHexStringToByte

        public static byte convertHexStringToByte(java.lang.String hexNumber)
                                   throws STException
        Converts a "2-char String" to a byte value. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertHexStringToByte("43"); // returns 0x43
        Parameters:
        hexNumber - String containing up to 2 hex ASCII characters
        Returns:
        Hex String representation on 1 byte
        Throws:
        STException - BAD_PARAMETER if hexNumber value is greater than 0xFF

      • convertIntTo3BytesHexaFormat

        public static byte[] convertIntTo3BytesHexaFormat(int numberToConvert)
                                           throws STException
        Converts an unsigned int value to a 3-byte array. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertIntTo3BytesHexaFormat(1876); // returns [0x00, 0x07, 0x54]
        Parameters:
        numberToConvert - unsigned int value to be converted to a byte array
        Returns:
        byte array
        Throws:
        STException - BAD_PARAMETER if number to convert is negative or greater than 65535

      • convert3BytesHexaFormatToInt

        public static int convert3BytesHexaFormatToInt(byte[] arrayToConvert)
        Converts a big-endian 3-byte Array to an int. Example: 
         
   Helper.convert3BytesHexaFormatToInt(0x000, 0x07, 0x54); // returns 1876
        Parameters:
        arrayToConvert - big-endian byte array to convert
        Returns:
        int value

      • convertIntTo2BytesHexaFormat

        public static byte[] convertIntTo2BytesHexaFormat(int numberToConvert)
                                           throws STException
        Converts an unsigned int value to a 2-byte array. Example: 
         
   Helper.convertIntTo2BytesHexaFormat(1876); // returns [0x07, 0x54]
        Parameters:
        numberToConvert - unsigned int value to be converted to a byte array
        Returns:
        byte array
        Throws:
        STException - BAD_PARAMETER if number to convert is negative or greater than 65535

      • convert2BytesHexaFormatToInt

        public static int convert2BytesHexaFormatToInt(byte[] arrayToConvert)
        Converts a big-endian 2-byte Array to an int. Example: 
         
   Helper.convert2BytesHexaFormatToInt(0x07, 0x54); // returns 1876
        Parameters:
        arrayToConvert - big-endian byte array to convert
        Returns:
        int value

      • readNextByteOfByteArrayInputStream

        public static byte readNextByteOfByteArrayInputStream(java.io.ByteArrayInputStream byteArrayInputStream)
                                               throws STException
        Reads the next byte of a ByteArrayInputStream and throws a STException if there is no more byte.
        Parameters:
        byteArrayInputStream - Input stream from which to read
        Returns:
        next byte of input stream
        Throws:
        STException - FILE_EMPTY if there is no more data to read

      • readNextBlockOfByteArrayInputStream

        @Deprecated
public static byte[] readNextBlockOfByteArrayInputStream(java.io.ByteArrayInputStream byteArrayInputStream,
                                                                      int nbrOfBytesPerBlock)
                                                               throws STException
        Deprecated. Use readByteArrayInputStream() which also checks for input values
        Reads the next block of a ByteArrayInputStream and throws a STException if there is no more data.
        Parameters:
        byteArrayInputStream - Input stream from which to read
        nbrOfBytesPerBlock - Size of a block in bytess
        Returns:
        byte array of size nbrOfBytesPerBlock
        Throws:
        STException - FILE_EMPTY if there is no more data to read

      • readByteArrayInputStream

        public static byte[] readByteArrayInputStream(java.io.ByteArrayInputStream byteArrayInputStream,
                                              int len)
                                       throws STException
        Reads len bytes of a ByteArrayInputStream and throws a STException if there is no more data to read.
        Parameters:
        byteArrayInputStream - Input stream from which to read
        len - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        byte array
        Throws:
        STException - FILE_EMPTY if there are less bytes to read than specified in len BAD_PARAMETER if byteArrayInputStream is null or less than 1 CMD_FAILED if a java exception occurred

      • concatenateByteArrays

        public static byte[] concatenateByteArrays(byte[] array1,
                                           byte[] array2)
        Concatenates two byte arrays. Example: 
         
   Helper.concatenateByteArrays(new byte[]{0x02, 0x03}, new byte[]{0x55}); // returns [0x02, 0x03, 0x55]
        Parameters:
        array1 - First array
        array2 - Second array
        Returns:
        byte array composed of {array1, array2}

      • reverseByteArray

        public static byte[] reverseByteArray(byte[] array)
        Reverses a given byte array. Example: 
         
   Helper.reverseByteArray(new byte[]{(byte) 0xE0, 0x02, 0x4D, (byte) 0xFF}); // returns [0xFF, 0x4D, 0x02, 0x0E]
        Parameters:
        array - byte array to be reversed
        Returns:
        array with reversed content

      • divisionRoundedUp

        public static int divisionRoundedUp(int num,
                                    int den)
                             throws STException
        Divides 2 integers and rounds the result to the upper integer. 
         
   Helper.divisionRoundedUp(3, 2); // returns 2
        Parameters:
        num - Left side of division operator
        den - Right side of division operator
        Returns:
        result of the division rounded up
        Throws:
        STException - BAD_PARAMETER if den is equal to 0

      • convertByteToUnsignedInt

        public static int convertByteToUnsignedInt(byte byteToConvert)
        Converts signed byte into an unsigned int value. Byte values greater than 0x80 are negative numbers for Java. Using the AND 0xFF operation avoids the sign bit propagation during the cast to an int.
        Parameters:
        byteToConvert - byte to convert
        Returns:
        the unsigned int value
